Body: Possible Duplicate:  Use Google Talk with multiple accounts  I always use two Google accounts. One for personal use, and the other for professional-related things. On my phone, I have Android 2.3.4 installed (not rooted). I heard that multiple users have been enabled for Honeycomb's Google Talk app. I need that same feature for my phone but I can't seem to find the latest Google Talk app on the Play Store in order for me to update the one that came with my phone. What should I do?Note: Google Talk's I need the voice calling feature as well.
Title: How to enable multiple users on Google Talk for Android 2.3.4?

history.Text: I always use two Google accounts. One for personal use, and the other for professional-related things. On my phone, I have Android 2.3.4 installed (not rooted). I heard that multiple users have been enabled for Honeycomb's Google Talk app. I need that same feature for my phone but I can't seem to find the latest Google Talk app on the Play Store in order for me to update the one that came with my phone. What should I do?**Note:** Google Talk's I need the voice calling feature as well.
How to enable multiple users on Google Talk for Android 2.3.4?

> **Possible Duplicate:**  > [Use Google Talk with multiple accounts](http://android.stackexchange.com/questions/8877/use-google-talk-with-multiple-accounts)  I always use two Google accounts. One for personal use, and the other for professional-related things. On my phone, I have Android 2.3.4 installed (not rooted). I heard that multiple users have been enabled for Honeycomb's Google Talk app. I need that same feature for my phone but I can't seem to find the latest Google Talk app on the Play Store in order for me to update the one that came with my phone. What should I do?**Note:** Google Talk's I need the voice calling feature as well.
